intro: Borreria suaveolens var. platyphylla, commonly known as the flatleaf bluemink, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant white or pale blue flowers that bloom in clusters, often in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are typically ovate to elliptic in shape and have a slightly hairy texture. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, rocky habitats.
